alert.note: Alert for Humboldt County; Northeastern Nye County; Northern Elko County; Northern Lander County and Northern Eureka County; Northwestern Nye County; Ruby Mountains and East Humboldt Range; South Central Elko County; Southeastern Elko County; Southern Lander County and Southern Eureka County; Southwest Elko County; White Pine County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 5:14PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...HOT TEMPERATURES WITH THUNDERSTORM CHANCES THIS WEEK... Expect the hottest temperatures of the year so far to occur this week. Afternoon highs will top out in the 90s to low 100s, peaking on Tuesday and Wednesday. Nighttime lows will only drop down into the 60s for most locations (low to mid 70s in and around West Wendover). Some relief from the heat may arrive during the weekend. Consider reducing, canceling or rescheduling strenuous activities to a cooler time of the day. If you are outdoors, wear light, loose-fitting clothing, stay hydrated and take breaks in the shade. Never leave children or animals in a vehicle for any amount of time as the temperature inside a car rapidly heats to a deadly level. In addition, thunderstorm chances will return to portions of central and northeast Nevada this week. The best potential looks to be across east-central Nevada. Storms could produce strong downdraft/outflow winds and dangerous cloud to ground lightning. Visit www.weather.gov/elko for the latest weather information.
